meanings.definition: The opening in the face through which food and drink are taken in and vocal sounds are emitted.
meanings.sent1: She ate the cookie by placing it in her mouth.
meanings.sent2: The baby's mouth was full of milk.
meanings.sent3: The mouth on the clock seemed to be talking as it ticked.
meanings.sent4: The cave's mouth yawned wide, inviting explorers inside.
meanings.sent5: Her mouth watered at the sight of the delicious cake.

meanings.definition: The point where a river enters a larger body of water.
meanings.sent1: The mouth of the river flowed into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman cast his line near the river's mouth.
meanings.sent3: The mouth of the river whispered secrets to the sea.
meanings.sent4: The mouth of the stream greeted the lake with a gentle kiss.
meanings.sent5: The mouth of the creek widened as it met the bay.

meanings.sent1: Her loud mouth got her into trouble.
meanings.sent2: His words were music to her ears.
meanings.sent3: The mouth of the politician never seemed to stop moving.
meanings.sent4: The poet's mouth painted pictures with every verse.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's mouth spoke wisdom that resonated with the students.
